description: Riesel problem: start with n; repeatedly double and add 1 until reach a prime. Sequence gives prime reached, or 0 if no prime is ever reached.
comments: Smallest prime of form (n+1)*2^k-1 for k >= 1 (or 0 if no such prime exists).a(509202)=0 (i.e. never reaches a prime) - Chris Nash (chris_nash(AT)hotmail.com). (Of course this is related to the entry 509203 of A076337.)a(73) is a 771-digit prime reached after 2552 iterations - _Warut Roonguthai_. This was proved to be a prime by Paul Jobling (Paul.Jobling(AT)WhiteCross.com) using PrimeForm and by _Ignacio Larrosa Ca√±estro_ using Titanix (http://www.znz.freesurf.fr/pages/titanix.html).
